      • verifyID

        public java.lang.String verifyID(java.lang.String documentNumber)
                          throws RepeatedDocumentException
        This method receives a document number to verify if its exists in the system. pre: An ArrayList that stores the users in the system has already been created. post: It is known if the document number is repeated or not.
        Parameters:
        documentNumber - is a String that corresponds to the document number to verify.
        Returns:
        String that indicates if the document number is accepted or not.
        Throws:
        RepeatedDocumentException

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(java.lang.String documentType,
                         java.lang.String documentNumber,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String lastNames,
                         java.lang.String phone,
                         java.lang.String address)
        This method receives the attributes of an user in order to register it in the system. pre: An ArrayList that stores the users in the system has already been created. post: A new user has been created and added to the system.
        Parameters:
        documentType - is a String that corresponds to the document type of the user to add.
        documentNumber - is a String that corresponds to the document number to verify.
        name - is a String that corresponds to the name of the user to add.
        lastNames - is a String that corresponds to the last names of the user to add.
        phone - is a String that corresponds to the phone of the user to add.
        address - is a String that corresponds to the address of the user to add.

      • findUser

        public java.lang.String findUser(java.lang.String id)
                          throws UserNotFoundException
        This method receives the id of an user in order to search it in the system and return its info. pre: An ArrayList that stores the users in the system has already been created. post: The information of the desired user is returned in a String.
        Parameters:
        id - is a String that correspond to the user id to search.
        Returns:
        String with the information of the found user.
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException

      • assignTurn

        public java.lang.String assignTurn(java.lang.String id)
                            throws UserAlreadyHasTurnException
        This method receives the id of an user in order to register him a turn. pre: An ArrayList that stores the users in the system has already been created. post: Next turn available is correctly assigned to the desired user.
        Parameters:
        id - is a String that correspond to the user id to register a turn.
        Returns:
        String indicating that the turn has been correctly assigned and its number.
        Throws:
        UserAlreadyHasTurnException

      • nextTurn

        public java.lang.String nextTurn()
        This method generates the number of the next turn available and returns it. pre: Global variables num (turn's number) and letter (turn's letter) have already been created. post: Next turn available is correctly generated and returned.
        Returns:
        Next turn available.

      • getActualTurn

        public java.lang.String getActualTurn()
        This method finds the actual turn to attend and returns it. pre: An ArrayList that stores the actual turns has already been created. post: It is know which is the actual turn to attend.
        Returns:
        actual turn to attend.

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn(int op,
                    java.lang.String turnID)
        This method ends a turn and places it where it corresponds. pre: ArrayLists that stores the attended turns and not attended turns have already been created. post: A given turn is ended and placed where it corresponds.
        Parameters:
        op - is an int that corresponds to the option chose by the user.
        turnID - is a String that corresponds to the turn id to end.
